subject: Pecan: Bulk create with one item returns plural
commit_message:
Pecan: Bulk create with one item returns plural

If a bulk create happened with a single item, the pecan code would
return back to the user the singular version of the resource in the
body.  For example, to bulk create many security group rules, the user
would give in the body of the request the json with a parent key of
"security-group-rules" with a value of a list of json security group
rules.  If this list is of length one, then after the creation of the
one security group rule, the API would return back to the client
"security-group-rule" as the parent key.  This is not how the legacy
wsgi layer behaved.  The behavior is expected when nova creates security
group rules by calling the neutron API through its deprecated security
groups API.

Change-Id: I8757630403e4d486cd3c8dd6f041e9ee326ba3b4
Closes-Bug: #1633671

its match field. So the number of ACL entries we need to create, is in
direct proportion to ports number and SG rules number.

After this patch, we will create ACL entries per each SG rule, and port
set will tell which ports are using a SG rule. So we will have ACL entry
like:
match: "inport == $sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID" or "outport == $sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID".
The "sg_ps_NEUTRON_SG_ID" will be a port set name, and in that set, there
are all port names(Neutron port ids), which belongs to ports are binding
to a SG rule. It tries to make number of ACL entris only be direct proportion
to SG rules number.

Since ACL entry is defined closer to a SG rule than a port, so ACL exteral_ids
will be changed to use SG rule id.

commit_message:
access-control: Allow network owner to update port

Previous policy.json has rules:
  "update_port": "rule:admin_or_owner or rule:context_is_advsvc",
and:
  "update_port:fixed_ips": "rule:admin_or_network_owner or
rule:context_is_advsvc"
the port attribute rule will be "blocked" by root rule.

With rbac, after tenant-A gives tenant-B access_as_shared privilege,
tenant-B user can create a port(port-B) on tenant-A network net-A.
Later, as network owner, tenant-A user may have some plans to update
fixed_ip for port-B. But tenant-A user will fail to do that, and get
"The resource could not be found." return message, for policy check
not pass on root rule for "update_port".

now. Such as mac_address, device_owner, etc.

This patch chooses using "admin_owner_or_network_owner" to replace
"admin_or_network_owner" to fix this.

Attention, even tenant-B is owner of port-B, we shouldn't give privilige
for tenant-B to update attribute like fixed_ips for port-B on net-A.
For tenant-B cannot only get ports not belong to tenant-B on net-A, so
give tenant-B privilege to update fixed_ips will cause unnecessary IP
conflict trouble. So it should be safe to keep current rule for port
attributes on update action.

subject: [l2pop] add timestamp to fdb to avoid concurrency
commit_message:
[l2pop] add timestamp to fdb to avoid concurrency

Port binding and status updates of a port can occur simultaneously
during migration and l2pop notifies agents for each update through RPC.
1) But these RPC calls can reach the agent at different times.
2) If they reach the agent in correct order also, agent's handlers
   might be simultaneously processing them
Because of 1) and 2) stale ovs flows might be added by agent for a port

To force synchronization, we add timestamp to PortContext during
port binding and status updates. This timestamp is passed as part of
fdb along with port.

When agent receives multiple fdbs for same port, it uses lock to
synchronize them and then fdb with latest timestamp will setup flows.
Agent also maintains dict of these port fdb(with latest timestamp).

Need work on compatibility with previous releases and
linux bridge agent changes.

subject: WIP: Serialize conflicting requests in task queue
commit_message:
WIP: Serialize conflicting requests in task queue

In ML2 mechanism driver, OVN updates are performed in post-commit,
which is after neutron DB transaction. With multi-workers/nodes,
the order of OVN updates are not guaranteed, which means the order
of OVN updates can be different from that of DB transaction commit
when there are racings between workers/nodes. This will result in
inconsistent data between OVN and Neutron DB.

This patch fixes the problem by serializing conflicting requests
in a task queue in DB. A place holder is marked in the queue in
precommit within the same DB transaction of the neutron DB change,
and during postcommit it checks and waits if there are conflicting
changes pending in the queue. This ensures ordering while keeping
the sync behaviour unchanged from client point of view, i.e. it
doesn't return until ovn nb operation complete.

- Now only port-update is involved, other operations TBD
- Indirect dependency mentioned by bug #1611852 will be fixed in
a separate patch

Closes-bug: #1605089

subject: Replace retrying with tenacity
commit_message:
Replace retrying with tenacity

We are replacing all usages of the 'retrying' package with
'tenacity' as the author of retrying is not actively maintaining
the project. Tenacity is a fork of retrying, but has improved the
interface and extensibility (see [1] for more details). Our end
goal here is removing the retrying package from our requirements.

Tenacity provides the same functionality as retrying, but has the
following major differences to account for:
- Tenacity uses seconds rather than ms as retrying did.
- Tenacity has different kwargs for the decorator and
Retrying class itself.
- Tenacity has a different approach for retrying args by
using classes for its stop/wait/retry kwargs.
- By default tenacity raises a RetryError if a retried callable
times out; retrying raises the last exception from the callable.
Tenacity provides backwards compatibility here by offering
the 'reraise' kwarg.
- Tenacity defines 'time.sleep' as a default value for a kwarg.
That said consumers who need to mock patch time.sleep
need to account for this via mocking of time.sleep before
tenacity is imported.
- For retries that check a result, tenacity will raise if the retried
function raises, whereas retrying retried on all exceptions.

This patch updates all usages of retrying with tenacity.
Unit tests will be included where applicable.

Note: This change is not newton critical so projects are welcome
to hold off on committing until post-newton. Ideally this change
will merge by the first part of Ocata so dependant functionality
can land and have time to solidify for Ocata.

[1] https://github.com/jd/tenacity

Closes-Bug: #1635395

Change-Id: I1c0620894d07d58efbba5226b5244fec950354ca
